task_summary: Detect the T block and target outline, approach and align the circular end-effector, establish contact, then push the block in three short strokes toward the target before retreating.

task_long_description.overview: A UR-style arm with a circular end-effector must push a T-shaped block across a white workspace to a fixed, outlined target T. The behavior runs at 10 Hz sensing and control. The robot first detects the block and the target outline, moves above the block, aligns orientation for a straight push, gently makes contact, and performs three short pushes to advance the block along the desired direction. After motion, the arm retreats to clear the workspace, leaving the block near the target.
preconditions: Workspace is clear except the T block and the target outline
Camera view provides visibility of block and target
End-effector is a rigid circular pusher
stepwise_plan: Move above block and align pusher
Lower until contact is detected by depth/force limit
Execute three pushes of fixed distance toward the target
success_criteria: T block reaches or overlaps the target outline
Arm ends clear of the object
failure_and_recovery: Perception misses object: re-detect before pushing
Misalignment causes drift: re-approach and realign, then continue pushing
Contact lost mid-push: lower again and resume remaining pushes
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after the push sequence completes and the arm retreats.

frame_3.now_evidence: Tool is vertically aligned and close to the block, indicating contact establishment.
frame_3.predicts_next: A forward push should follow along the aligned direction.

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Move above the block to a safe height.
Align approach to prepare a straight push.
Orient the end-effector to push along the chosen direction.
Lower to establish gentle contact with the block.
Push the block forward; executed three times via Repeat.
Back off to clear the block after pushing.

failure_modes: Object not detected or partially occluded
Under/over-shoot due to slip or misalignment
Push direction inconsistent with target path
recovery_strategy: Execute remaining pushes only after alignment
assumptions: Frames show a red T block and a blue outline target, while the instruction mentions gray/green/blue; color mismatch resolved in favor of frames.
Push direction chosen as 90Â° based on apparent motion toward the outline; exact direction not explicitly measurable from stills.

expected_success_criteria: Block reaches/overlaps the outline after three pushes
Arm retreats to a safe distance
